The phoenix is a primordial bird made of heat and flame that dwells in the most inhospitable regions of the desert. Though highly intelligent and usually brimming with compassion, phoenixes are best known for their iconic ability to resurrect themselves when slain, emerging reborn from the ashes of their own corpses. Phoenixes are often sought out for their knowledge of healing abilities, as they cannot abide the sight of suffering and deny their succor only to the most foul and irredeemable of creatures. Phoenixes enjoy the company of peaceful dragons, and the two can forge lifelong friendships, keeping each other updated on regional news. While most phoenixes are benevolent, they are not infallible. When a phoenix loses their way, they still retain their strong appetite for knowledge. Malevolent phoenixes are known to assault universities and libraries in their pursuit for power—not only to gain new information, but also to set fire to the texts and thus hoard that knowledge for themselves. **[Recall Knowledge - Beast](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 39 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 37 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 [Phoenix](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3137) **Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 264 1.1 **Perception** +27; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [_detect magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1485), [_see the unseen_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1663) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Empyrean](/Languages.aspx?ID=115), [Pyric](/Languages.aspx?ID=110), [Sussuran](/Languages.aspx?ID=111) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +30, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +27, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +31, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +27, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +25 **Str** +6 **Dex** +7 **Con** +5 **Int** +7 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 36 **Fort** +27 **Ref** +31 **Will** +28 +1 status to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=644) **HP** 300 , regeneration 20 (deactivated by [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=555) or [unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)) **Immunities** [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) **Weaknesses** cold 10, unholy 10 **Shroud of Flame** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) 20 feet. 4d6 fire, DC 37 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. While this aura is active, any adjacent creature that hits the phoenix with a melee attack or otherwise touches them takes 2d6 fire damage. The phoenix can activate or deactivate the aura with a single action, which has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561) trait.
**Self-Resurrection** ([healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=676)) When a phoenix dies, they collapse into a pile of smoldering ashes before returning to life fully healed 1d4 rounds later, as if subject to a 7th-rank [_resurrect_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=123) ritual. Self-resurrection happens only if there are some remains to resurrect; for instance, a phoenix killed by a [_disintegrate_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1492) spell can't use this ability. A phoenix whose remains rest within an area devoted to an unholy deity by [_consecrate_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=115) can't self-resurrect until their remains are no longer in that area. A phoenix can self-resurrect only once per year. --- **Speed** 25 feet, fly 70 feet **Melee** beak +30 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 1d12+9 piercing plus 3d8 fire and 2d10 [persistent fire](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) **Melee** talon +30 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 1d6+6 piercing plus 3d8 fire and 2d10 [persistent fire](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) **Ranged** flame jet +30 ([Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [range increment 40 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 6d6 fire plus 2d10 [persistent fire](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) **Primal Inante Spells** DC 39 - **Cantrips (8th)** [Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=1585) - **6th** [Cleanse Affliction](/Spells.aspx?ID=1467) (x3) - **7th** [Dispel Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=1493) (at will) - **8th** [Cleanse Affliction](/Spells.aspx?ID=1467), [Dispel Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=1493) (x3), [Divine Immolation](/Spells.aspx?ID=1496), [Everlight](/Spells.aspx?ID=1518) (at will), [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=1554) (x3), [Wall of Fire](/Spells.aspx?ID=1748) (x3) - **Constant (6th)** [See the Unseen](/Spells.aspx?ID=1663) - **Constant (8th)** [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=1485) **Flaming Strafe** ([Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The phoenix blazes with superheated flame and [Flies](/Actions.aspx?ID=2312) up to their Speed. They deal 6d6 fire damage to each creature within 20 feet of each square they move through (DC 37 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save).
Servants of Sarenrae While phoenixes are not denizens of the Outer Planes, they have long been associated with the goddess [Sarenrae](/Deities.aspx?ID=292). Indeed, many phoenixes view the Dawnflower as their patron and subscribe to her mission of redeeming those who have fallen to evil.
